resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.

fields.summary: High contention on scanning of user directory under immediate_done in Job History Server

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Job history server scans can become blocked on a single, slow entry

comments.body:
Thanks [~Prabhu Joseph] for raising this jira.

under this block {{synchronized(firstValue)}} , we are majorly invoking {{firstValue.delete()}} which is having a lock and {{cache.remove(key)}}. Here *cache* is concurrent skiplist and its safe to use.. So i think we can remove the *synchronized* block as mentioned. From new thread dump, which is similar to the one from  MAPREDUCE-6684, it looks very clear that {{addIfAbsent}} is now the bottleneck.

Thoughts [~jlowe] / [~haibochen] [~kasha].
It looks like the lock here can be removed.
If multiple threads call {{addIfAbsent}} simultaneously, is it possible they process the same {{HistoryFileInfo}}? How do we ensure only one thread is processing a file?

[~kasha] Multiple threads calling addIfAbsent simultaneously and processing a same HistoryFileInfo is possible and that won't face any issue even after removing synchronized block as the operations inside are thread safe and also idempotent.
[~jlowe] [~kasha] [~sunilg]  Need your help in reviewing the patch.

| (x) *{color:red}-1 overall{color}* |

Thanks for the patch!

As I mentioned above, I think we're OK with the lock removal, but I'd like to hear from [~kasha] before committing.  It'd also be good to cleanup the indentation warnings from checkstyle.

Thanks [~jlowe] for the review. Took some time to learn the checkstyle issues. Hi [~kasha], need your help to review this.

I am a little too caught up for the next two weeks to take a good look. I am comfortable with the change since [~jlowe] has approved it.

 [~haibochen] - as the last person who worked on this code, are you able to verify the change?
Agree with [~Prabhu Joseph] that the removal of synchronize block is safe.
+1 for the latest patch.  Committing this.
Thanks to [~Prabhu Joseph] for the contribution and to [~sunilg], [~kasha], and [~haibochen] for additional review!  I committed this to trunk, branch-2, and branch-2.8.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #10833 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/10833/])
